summary_points: 1. NVR, Inc. amended and restated its credit agreement on March 11, 2025, extending its $300 million senior unsecured revolving credit facility's maturity date to March 11, 2030, and including an accordion feature to potentially increase the commitment to $600 million.
2.  The amended credit agreement includes a $100 million sublimit for letters of credit.

3. The amended agreement contains financial covenants substantially similar to the prior agreement, including maximum leverage, interest coverage, minimum liquidity, and minimum tangible net worth ratios.
1. Crown Castle Inc. rescheduled the release of its fourth-quarter and full-year 2024 financial results and related conference call to March 13, 2025, due to a strategic review of its Fiber segment.
2.  The company's fourth-quarter 2024 earnings release was originally scheduled for March 12th, 2025, but was postponed to March 13th, 2025.
3. The replay of the March 13th, 2025 conference call webcast will be available until March 13th, 2026.
1. Gilead Sciences, Inc. announced on March 12, 2025, that Sandra Patterson, its Senior Vice President, Corporate Controller, and Chief Accounting Officer, resigned.
2.  Diane E. Wilfong, who previously served as Gilead's Corporate Controller and Chief Accounting Officer from February 2016 to March 2023, was appointed as interim replacement.
3. The company will conduct a search for a permanent successor to Ms. Patterson.

1. Nasdaq, Inc. filed an 8-K on March 12, 2025, reporting new employment agreements for Adena T. Friedman (Chair and CEO), Tal Cohen (President), and Bradley J. Peterson (Executive Vice President and Chief Information and Chief Technology Officer), all extending through at least January 1, 2028, with significant compensation packages including substantial equity awards and severance packages.
2. Ms. Friedman's 2025 equity award target value is $15,000,000, while Mr. Cohen's is $6,000,000 plus a one-time $7,000,000 equity award, and Mr. Peterson's is $3,200,000.

3.  Upon a Qualifying Termination within six months prior to, or two years following, a change in control, Ms. Friedman will receive a lump sum cash payment equal to two times her base salary, two times her target bonus and a pro-rata bonus, and full vesting of her outstanding equity awards.  Similar, though potentially less lucrative,  change in control protections are in place for Mr. Cohen and Mr. Peterson.
1. IBM's Software revenue increased by 9% year-over-year in 2024 (at constant currency), while Consulting revenue saw a 1% increase.
2.  IBM is restructuring its Software and Consulting segment revenue categories, effective Q1 2025, requiring model updates before the April 2025 earnings report.
3. This revenue category restructuring will not alter IBM's consolidated financials or reportable segments.
1. Broadcom's Q1 2025 net revenue increased 25% year-over-year to $14,916 million, driven by strong demand for AI networking solutions and VMware Cloud Foundation.
2. Broadcom holds $10,745 million in unrecognized compensation costs related to unvested stock options, to be recognized over the next 2.9 years (as of February 2, 2025).
3.  Unrecognized tax benefits could change by up to $3,474 million in the next year (from February 2025).
1. Target's net sales decreased by $0.8 billion (0.8%) in 2024 compared to 2023, primarily due to a shorter fiscal year.
2. Target plans to spend $4 billion to $5 billion on capital expenditures in 2025, mainly for new stores and supply chain improvements.
3.  Target's total lease liabilities increased by $475 million year-over-year to $6.096 billion as of February 1, 2025.

1. On March 12, 2025, MGM Resorts International appointed Donna Langley, Chairman of NBCUniversal Entertainment & Studios, to its Board of Directors, increasing the board size from twelve to thirteen members.
2. Langley's annual director retainer, along with those of other independent directors, was increased to $100,000 in May 2024 (before her appointment).
3.  Langley received a pro-rated grant of restricted stock units with a target value of $53,750 upon her appointment on March 12, 2025, vesting within one year.
1. Adobe reported record Q1 fiscal year 2025 revenue of $5.71 billion, representing 10% year-over-year growth (11% in constant currency), as of February 28, 2025.
2.  For the second quarter of fiscal year 2025, Adobe is targeting non-GAAP diluted earnings per share of $4.95 to $5.00.
3. Adobe reaffirmed its fiscal year 2025 targets, assuming current macroeconomic conditions, projecting total revenue between $23.30 billion and $23.55 billion.
1. Micron Technology, Inc. entered into a new $3.5 billion revolving credit agreement on March 12, 2025, increasing its credit facility by $1 billion compared to its previous agreement.
2.  The new credit agreement replaces the existing $2.5 billion facility, which was set to mature on May 14, 2026, with a new facility maturing on March 12, 2030.

3. The new credit agreement includes a net leverage ratio covenant of 3.25 to 1.00, which could increase to 3.75 to 1.00 after certain acquisitions,  a change from the previous gross leverage ratio covenant.
1. Steel Dynamics, Inc. completed a $1 billion notes offering on March 12, 2025, receiving net proceeds of approximately $972 million after expenses.
2. The company plans to use the net proceeds from the sale of the notes for general corporate purposes, which may include repayment of its 2.400% Notes due 2025.
3. The Notes are senior unsecured obligations, ranking equally with existing and future senior indebtedness but subordinated to secured indebtedness and all subsidiary liabilities.
1. AES Corp announced on March 12, 2025, a proposed public offering of senior notes due 2032 and a cash tender offer to purchase all outstanding 3.300% Senior Notes due 2025.
2.  The tender offer involves $900,000,000 of outstanding 3.300% Senior Notes due 2025.
3. The success of the tender offer is contingent upon AES obtaining sufficient debt financing by March 21, 2025 (or an extended date).
1. Emerson Electric Co. completed its acquisition of Aspen Technology, Inc. on March 12, 2025.
2. Approximately 72% of AspenTech's outstanding shares (excluding those held by Emerson and its subsidiaries, and directors and officers of both companies) were tendered in the offer.

3.  The acquisition of AspenTech was completed on March 12, 2025, with each remaining AspenTech share (excluding those already owned by Emerson and those subject to appraisal rights) converted into the right to receive $265 in cash.
1. Centene Corp reaffirmed its 2025 adjusted diluted earnings per share (EPS) guidance of greater than $7.25 on March 12, 2025.

2.  The company's presentation at the Barclays 27th Annual Global Healthcare Conference on March 12, 2025, included non-GAAP financial measures, which the company believes provide a clearer picture of its core business performance.

3. Centene Corp's future performance is subject to various risks, including competition, healthcare cost fluctuations, and changes in government healthcare regulations (including potential changes to the ACA).
1. On March 10, 2025, Advanced Micro Devices Inc. entered into an underwriting agreement for a $1.5 billion public offering of senior notes, with an anticipated closing date of March 24, 2025.
2.  The offering consists of $875 million in 4.212% senior notes due 2026 and $625 million in 4.319% senior notes due 2028.
3. Net proceeds from the offering will fund a portion of the acquisition of ZT Systems; if the acquisition fails, the funds will be used for general corporate purposes.
1. News Corp repurchased approximately US$646,928,533.70 worth of Class A and Class B shares as of March 11, 2025, under a US$1 billion stock repurchase program.
2. On March 11, 2025,  21,198,812 Class A shares and 10,459,772 Class B shares were repurchased at a highest price of US$30.69 and US$35.25 respectively.
3. News Corp's future share repurchases are subject to market conditions, the market price of its stock, and other factors, with no guarantee of further purchases.
